poll_list.title: Badgeholder Nomination Voting
poll_list.body: As part of the recently announced [retroPGF 2](https://optimism.mirror.xyz/wqk1Yeyn2OhV9paDzbRXvQ0m0JYDu2npbSkMClwk1rY) , voting badges will be distributed to a set of 90 community members. One voting badge will be given to 10 Token House delegates. Below are all valid nominations (please see [the original post](https://gov.optimism.io/t/token-house-badgeholder-nominations/4196/12) and [Token House Badgeholder Election Information](https://gov.optimism.io/t/token-house-badgeholder-election-information/4195)  for more information.)
poll_list.author: 0x47C88bb92B409fF25F6587EA611fac4e55f76007

content.content: Please refer to the Badgeholder Nominations Roundup for the final list of valid nominations  As part of the recently announced retroPGF 2, voting badges will be distributed to a set of 90 community members. One voting badge will be given to 10 Token House delegates. Each delegate with greater than >0.5% voting power may nominate 2 Token House delegates to be badgeholders for rPGF 2. All nominees must be individual Token House delegates that have submitted a delegate commitment by 12/5/22. Each of the 10 elected Token House delegates will be able to distribute an additional badge to an individual of their choosing. If you have >0.5% votable supply and would like to nominate a delegate, please post nominations (using the template outlined here) below by December 14th at 7pm GMT.
content.GPT-summary: The post explains the process for nominating Token House delegates to be badgeholders for retroPGF 2. It also provides information on how the voting badges will be distributed and who is eligible to nominate a delegate. The author is explaining the proposal and asking for nominations from eligible community members.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal
3rd party or author wants to collaborate on proposal

content.content: Hi folks - we would like to nominate two delegates for this role. After working with both in DeFi Committee A, we are impressed by their sensibility and passion for the OP ecosystem.   Nominating delegate: Flipside Crypto   Link to delegate commitment: Delegate Commitments - #69 by fig   Link to verify delegation of >0.5% of the votable supply: Boardroom - flipsidecrypto.eth   Name of delegate you’d like to nominate: lindajxie.eth & katiegarcia.eth   Link to nominee’s delegate commitment: Linda Xie: Delegate Commitments - #37 by linda Katie Garcia: Delegate Commitments - #18 by katie   Why do you believe this delegate should receive an rPGF 2 voting badge? @katie and @linda share a wide knowledge of the industry and have aligned incentives. We are confident in their ability to recognize and reward impactful public goods as they see them.   Best of luck to these two and any other delegates seeking nomination! There is a trove of qualified delegates.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving entirely positive feedback on proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: Updated to clarify the below:     lavande:  All nominees must be Token House delegates that have submitted a delegate commitment by 12/5/22

Nominating delegate: Solarcurve  Link to delegate commitment: Delegate Commitments - #44 by solarcurve   Link to verify delegation of >0.5% of the votable supply: Optimism | OP Token House - Delegate Voting Weight Tracker 🔴🏛 I’m #31 with 0.65% of votable supply at time of writing  Name of delegate you’d like to nominate: Stablenode  Link to nominee’s delegate commitment: Delegate Commitments - #59 by Bobbay_StableNode   Why do you believe this delegate should receive an rPGF 2 voting badge? Stablenode has been a diligent participant in Optimism governance from the start of Season 1. They have engaged with proposers to offer feedback and have consistently reported back on their reasoning for why they voted how they did. Beyond this they have also been an active delegate at Balancer where I’m a contributor. Despite the fact they are not compensated there they still take the time to provide thoughtful feedback and most importantly always vote - and we often have a lot of votes    From my interactions with Stablenode and Bobby in particular I can say without a doubt Optimism would be in good hands if they are granted a Badge for this initiative.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving entirely positive feedback on proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: Nominating delegate: MinimalGravitas   Link to delegate commitment: Delegate Commitments - #25 by MinimalGravitas   Link to verify delegation of >0.5% of the votable supply: Boardroom      Name of delegate you’d like to nominate: Lefteris   Link to nominee’s delegate commitment: Delegate Commitments - #9 by lefterisjp   Why do you believe this delegate should receive an rPGF 2 voting badge? @Lefterisjp has been both an unerring advocate for open source software, probably the most fundamental and relevant form of public good at this stage; and a constant contributor to governance of the OP Token House. Additionally they have demonstrated a very long term commitment to the wider Ethereum ecosystem, of which Optimism is finding it’s place within. All these factors combine to make Lefteris an example of exactly the type of person I want to see in this roll!      Name of delegate you’d like to nominate: OPUser   Link to nominee’s delegate commitment: Delegate Commitments - #26 by OPUser   Why do you believe this delegate should receive an rPGF 2 voting badge? @OPUser has shown a dedication to Optimism’s Governance that I’d suggest few have matched, they have been active in almost every discussion since they joined, and recently have led the DeFi Committee C in Season 2. While they are not a well known name in crypto (like my other nominee) and don’t have their own project to promote, their lack of bias or ulterior motives that in my view would make them an excellent candidate to receive a citizenship.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: Name : Catdl   Address or ENS : 0xB24B961C30F5a4A0F599513c52b790c2b369d7e0   Discord username : Catdl#1963   Verification : Tweet https://twitter.com/Meomuop1983/status/1601615950687531009   I have read and understood the Delegate Commitment Process : Yes, i read and understand.   I understand that becoming a delegate is a significant commitment : Yes i understand   My reasons for wanting to be a delegate : I am a member of Fractal Visions, I love the way they create the arts. That’s the reason why I am here to vote, to defend and to support them. Within short time after participating, their arts made me really surprise. Therefore, to be able to continue to follow and support Fractal Visions, I want to be a Delegator.   My view on the Optimistic Vision : I know about Optimistic for a long time ago, I am also a member, who are following Optimistic almost half year. For sure, I believe in Optimistic, and I know the way team choosing is right, WEB3, NFT with strong community always is the best.   My view on the first three articles of the Working Constitution : I appreciate the framing of the constitution as a working document, love the basic two house structure. In the future, I hope that Optimistic can keep the original spirit and for sure, I always be here, together.   My Web3 interests : DAOs, DeFi, Visual Arts, NFTs.   Languages I speak and write : Vietnamese and English.   My skills and areas of expertise : Trade   My favorite Web3 projects : Ganland / Fractalicia L2Dao / QiDao Lyra / Clipper
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving entirely positive feedback on proposal

content.content: Nominating Delegate: Heartistry.eth Link to delegate commitment:     Delegate Commitments 🏛 Governance       Name: Heartistry  Address: Heartistry.eth  Discord: Heartistry#4652  Twitter Verification:    My reasons for wanting to be a delegate?  I have a compassionate viewpoint with the goal of bettering spaces, standing as, with, and for artists in a sustainable way, evolving and being at the forefront of technology, art, and music.  I have read and understood the Delegate Commitment Process?  Yes  My view on the Optimistic Vision?  I like how you conceptualised the idea of a sustainable self governing…     Link to verify delegation of >0.5% of the votable supply:    boardroom.io    Boardroom The DAO Discovery and Governance Platform      Name of delegate you’d like to nominate: Fractal Visions Link to nominees delegate commitment:     Delegate Commitments 🏛 Governance       Name: Fractal Visions  Address or ENS: 0xC4FC57Dedd2463314A3fD2DBadB86B4404C257e5  Discord username: Fractal Visions#7535  Verification (Tally profile or tweet): Tweet  I have read and understood the Delegate Commitment Process: Yes, it is important to be a leader in the artist community for myself and the other artists I work with.  I understand that becoming a delegate is a significant commitment: Absolutely… I am here to represent the creative souls in the space, visionary leaders!  My reason…     Why do you believe this delegate should receive an rPGF 2 voting badge? I believe Fractal Visions deserve to be a delegate because of their perspicuity  and kind hearted spirit to help onboard people into the culture of web3 technology with the artists at the heart of what they do. Having got to know them quite well over the past fast approaching 2 years. They have been a solid support system in my education in the space and inducted me into the optimism network. They are dedicated to creating opportunities for artists and utilising it for public goods. In hearts, minds, and reality. A true visionary.

content.content: Nominating delegate: jackanorak.eth  Link to delegate commitment: Delegate Commitments - #136 by jackanorak   Link to verify delegation of >0.5% of the votable supply: Optimism | OP Token House - Delegate Voting Weight Tracker   #30 with 0.65% of voting weight  Name of delegate you’d like to nominate: @millie @MinimalGravitas   Link to nominees’ delegate commitments: Delegate Commitments - #65 by mastermojo Delegate Commitments - #25 by MinimalGravitas   Given these criteria:    Is this person a proven advocate for the value of public goods, in crypto or beyond?   Can this person help advance the process and structure of retroPGF as a funding mechanism?   Is this person a domain expert in any of the categories up for funding in RetroPGF 2?   Has this person shown strong alignment with the long term growth of the Optimism ecosystem and the mission of the Collective?  @millie and @MinimalGravitas are two deeply involved figures in Optimism coming from different poles of interest. Both of them are undeniably model citizens along these dimensions, and I’d love for them to help shape the future of RPGF. Millie’s most visible role within governance is as a Synthetix Ambassador, but I think anybody who’s spent time around the Optimism eco knows him as a highly independent thinker with a genuine commitment to the most fundamental tenets of Optimism, defi, and crypto more broadly. I know from the many disagreements we’ve had that he’s clearly a domain expert and general brain with regard to the app layer and that he’d be quick to offer improvements and see what others might not. @MinimalGravitas, coming from a different view, has been a consistently thoughtful, principled voice coming from within governance, someone whose desire to keep pushing Optimism toward bigger goals is evident. They’ve put in time where others haven’t, participating in conversations of all kinds, spotting unique angles, and asking challenging questions. I’d feel comfortable knowing they were an advocate. And critically, discussions on RPGF would I think be directly in their wheelhouse; they are as much an authority on all things ‘public good’ from first principles as anyone I’ve witnessed among the highly active individuals here.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: Nominating delegate: lefteris.eth  Link to delegate commitment: Delegate Commitments - #9 by lefterisjp   Link to verify delegation of >0.5% of the votable supply: Boardroom   Name of delegate you’d like to nominate: @krzkaczor @jackanorak   Link to nominees’ delegate commitments: Delegate Commitments - #136 by jackanorak Delegate Commitments - #47 by krzkaczor    Why do you believe this delegate should receive an rPGF 2 voting badge?  @krzkaczor: I worked both with him and @kaereste in the tooling committee and I think their team is really dedicated to the optimism vision and public goods funding @jackanorak: I have not worked with them directly, but the way they carry themselves in the forums, the way they worked with the shadow committee and the detailed and very well thought out posts here point me to a person who cares and who wold really make an excellent person to help push retroPGF.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: @Catdl @Heartistry @MinhDuc @nhungmeo @ego97516 @Firozasmust It appears that you are all nominating @FractalVisions on behalf of Fractal Visions (given the requirement of >0.5% voting power) but please correct me if one of you individually has >0.5% voting power. Unfortunately, delegates may not nominate themselves as outlined in Token House Badgeholder Election Information  so Fractal Visions cannot nominate itself. Additionally, nominees must be individual delegates, so an individual representative of Fractal Visions would need to be nominated. If one of you individually holds >0.5% voting power, you may nominate an individual representative of Fractal Visions (see nominations for bobbay on behalf of Stablenode, for reference)
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
None of the topics listed match
